meanings.sent1: The jaloppies parked in the junkyard were covered in rust.
meanings.sent2: I saw a few jaloppies on the side of the road, abandoned and forgotten.
meanings.sent3: The jaloppies in the race looked like they were barely holding together!
meanings.sent4: The jaloppies on the street seemed like relics from a bygone era.
meanings.sent5: The jaloppies in the movie were so beat-up, they stole the show!

meanings.definition: Jaloppies (verb): to drive recklessly or carelessly in a jalopy
meanings.sent1: He jaloppies through the neighborhood, scaring pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: She always jaloppies when she's running late for work.
meanings.sent3: The kids decided to jaloppies around the parking lot for fun.
meanings.sent4: The teenager jaloppies down the empty road, feeling free.
meanings.sent5: The delivery driver jaloppies through traffic to make quick deliveries.

meanings.definition: Jaloppies (adjective): describing something as old, run-down, or in poor condition
meanings.sent1: The jaloppies house at the end of the street needed a lot of repairs.
meanings.sent2: She wore a jaloppies sweater that was full of holes.
meanings.sent3: The jaloppies playground equipment creaked with every movement.
meanings.sent4: The jaloppies barn stood crooked in the field, abandoned and forgotten.
meanings.sent5: The jaloppies bridge swayed in the wind, looking like it could collapse at any moment.
